title: Soil Amendment Myths | From the Ground Up

tasks.task: Explain why certain garden products should be avoided in Wyoming.
subtasks: Discuss why gypsum is not suitable for general soil conditioning.
Explain how to properly test for sodic soils before using gypsum.
Clarify the limitations of gypsum in adjusting soil pH or lightening clay soils unless sodic.
Advise against the use of lime in Wyoming gardens.
Explain why most Wyoming soils are already high in calcium and alkaline.
Promote the use of organic matter such as compost, mulch, or manure to improve soil health.
Recommend consulting a local Extension educator for soil testing and management advice.
